other_tests.findings: Negative for salmonella, shigella, campylobacter, aeromonas, plesiomonas, and Escherichia coli O157:H7; negative for rotavirus, giardia, and Clostridium difficile toxin.

Turbid amber urine; 2+ blood, 3+ albumin, 3+ leukocyte esterase; specific gravity 1.012; pH 5.0; sediment showed transitional cells, squamous cells, amorphous crystals, mucin, bacteria, 20-50 red cells, and >100 white cells per high-power field.
Histopathological examination revealed thrombotic microangiopathy and cortical tubular necrosis.
64% (normal range, ≥70), indicating mild reduction inconsistent with thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura.
<10% (normal range, ≥46), consistent with atypical hemolytic–uremic syndrome.
